attributes.action: Change the 2021 GCSEs to open book exams due to COVID-19 disruptions.
attributes.additional_details: Students year 10 through 13 are all under exam stress regardless of COVID, but now we, students, face added anxiety; now more than ever we face uncertainty. Moreover many have lost loved ones yet still tackle their education at home. Post-Covid life will not be the same after lockdown, as we near to the new academic year this September. With a possible second wave lingering, please think ahead and do not leave our exams till the last minute. We want reassurance now, not weeks before our exams.
attributes.background: To consider open book exams for the 2021 GCSEs. It is evident that COVID-19 has disrupted education for all, this academic year. Thus, with Year 11 being most vital in GCSEs, it is unjust to allow students to sit through normal exam conditions. Our GCSEs decide our careers and shape our lives.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament. 

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Reduce curriculum content for year 10 & 12 students who will sit exams in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320772

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570
